item.description:
John Galluzzo, Adult Program Coordinator and Citizen Science Coordinator, Mass Audubon South Shore Sanctuaries, will conduct a training walk to show volunteers how to count birds for the Breeding Bird Atlas 2 (BBA2) project (see event for 6/17 above).

Please consider helping with the BBA2 project. Volunteers will receive training that will enable you to count birds and complete the forms correctly. The data you collect will be used to track bird population changes since 1979, when the BBA1 was completed.

It is not mandatory to sign up for bird counting to go on the training walk. The walk will begin at the headquarters parking lot.

This is a wonderful hike for young people or for people just getting into bird watching or bird support, as John points out many interesting things to look for when learning about birds.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Bird Walk - Atlasing MSSF for Mass Audubon Breeding Bird Atlas 2
